data.title: Ethereum's Scaling Roadmap Unveiled by Vitalik Buterin
data.description: Vitalik Buterin has outlined Ethereum's scaling roadmap, which includes short-term upgrades set to be implemented in the upcoming Glamsterdam fork. According to NS3.AI, these enhancements will feature block-level access lists, ePBS, and multidimensional gas, all designed to improve execution efficiency and better manage state growth. In the long term, the scaling plans aim to increase blob throughput to facilitate the expansion of Ethereum's network.

data.title: Brazil's Soybean Exports Face Delays Amid Record Harvest
data.description: Brazil is experiencing significant delays in soybean exports due to logistical challenges at river ports. According to Jin10, the country has achieved a record soybean harvest, but the transportation of these goods is being hindered by congestion and infrastructure limitations. This situation is raising concerns about potential increases in shipping costs, which could impact the global soybean market. The delays are primarily attributed to the high volume of produce needing transport and the limited capacity of existing port facilities. As a result, there is a growing risk of shipping costs spiraling out of control, which could have broader implications for international trade and commodity prices. Stakeholders are closely monitoring the situation, as prolonged disruptions could affect supply chains and market dynamics.

data.title: Citibank plans to launch institutional-grade Bitcoin custody services in 2026.
data.description: Nisha Surendran, Head of Digital Asset Custody Development at Citibank, announced at an industry event hosted by Strategy that Citibank plans to integrate Bitcoin into its core banking business later in 2026, offering institutional-grade custody services, key management, and a wallet system. The platform will extend traditional tax reporting, compliance, and risk management processes to Bitcoin holdings, and will support 24/7 operation, SWIFT global transfer messaging, and API connectivity. Citibank currently manages approximately $30 trillion in assets, and this move aims to remove operational barriers to crypto assets for institutional investors such as pension funds and insurance companies. Surendran stated that the initial phase will focus on core custody functions, with subsequent expansion to include asset segregation and collateral management services.

data.title: Vitalik Buterin published an article outlining Ethereum's scaling plan, covering short-term gas optimization and long-term phased deployment of ZK-EVM.
data.description: Vitalik Buterin stated in an article on the X platform that Ethereum scaling is divided into short-term and long-term parts. In the short term, the Glamsterdam upgrade will introduce a block-level access list to enable parallel verification, ePBS will allow for a larger proportion of time slots to be used for block verification, and Gas repricing will ensure that operational costs are aligned with actual execution time. The multi-dimensional Gas mechanism will be implemented in stages. Firstly, in Glamsterdam, the cost of "state creation" will be separated from the cost of "execution and calldata," with state creation Gas not included in the approximately 16 million transaction Gas cap. At the EVM level, a "reservoir" dimension mechanism will be introduced, prioritizing the consumption of dedicated dimension Gas by default, and consuming from the reservoir when insufficient. Later, it will transition to multi-dimensional pricing, with different dimensions having different floating Gas prices. Long-term scaling includes ZK-EVM and blob. Regarding blobs, the plan is to continuously iterate PeerDAS, aiming to achieve a data processing capacity of approximately 8MB per second. In the future, Ethereum block data will directly enter the blob. The ZK-EVM rollout will proceed in phases: in 2026, validator clients supporting ZK-EVM will be available, allowing approximately 5% of the network to run; in 2027, this will be expanded to a larger proportion of a small number of nodes, while formal verification will be promoted; once conditions are ripe, it will transition to a three-out-of-five mandatory proof mechanism, ultimately continuously improving the security and formal verification level of ZK-EVM, and involving VM changes such as RISC-V.

data.title: Private Credit Lenders Seek Higher Margin on German Insurance Broker Loan Amid AI Concerns
data.description: Private credit lenders are demanding an increased margin on a €1.2 billion loan to a German insurance broker, driven by apprehensions regarding the potential risks artificial intelligence (AI) poses to the industry. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the lenders' concerns about AI's impact on the insurance sector, which has prompted them to seek better terms on the loan. The move reflects broader unease in the financial markets about AI's transformative effects and the uncertainties it introduces to traditional business models. As AI continues to evolve, lenders are increasingly cautious, seeking to mitigate potential risks associated with its integration into various sectors.

data.title: South Africa Proposes Cheaper Electricity to Support Ferrochrome Industry
data.description: South Africa has proposed offering reduced electricity rates to Glencore's ferrochrome smelting venture and Samancor Chrome’s operations in an effort to preserve employment in the sector. By providing cheaper electricity, the government hopes to alleviate some of these financial burdens and ensure the continued operation of these significant industrial players.

data.title: Norway Exempts Emission Trading Companies from CO2 Tax
data.description: Norway has announced that companies participating in emission trading will be exempt from paying the carbon dioxide tax. According to Jin10, the Norwegian government stated that this exemption will not affect the country's climate commitments. The decision aims to support businesses involved in emission trading while maintaining Norway's environmental goals. The government reassures that the exemption aligns with their climate policies and will not hinder efforts to reduce carbon emissions.

data.title: Yandex Founder Arkady Volozh Renounces Russian Citizenship
